department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
description: The Contracting Authority is currently soliciting an Expression of Interest for the LC4ISR Capability sustainment services, to ascertain the interest of industry and to confirm whether bidders will meet the registration requirements set out in the Security Requirement Checklist. This RFP is an invitation to bid for the LC4ISR Capability Core Network Sustainment Services requirement.The purpose of the RFP is to secure the services of request for the LC4ISR Capability sustainment services, which includes production, testing, and delivery to procure suppliers capacity to configure and install customized software applications. Supply of field service personnel, to include technical support services to be stored dynamically by immigration systems.

full_summary:
**CORE NETWORK SUSTAINMENT SERVICES**

**Official Solicitation Number:** W8486-228517/A
**Publication Date:** December 22, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** February 16, 2023, at 14:00:00

**Transaction Description:**
This solicitation seeks to engage a supplier for the provision of Core Network Sustainment Services in support of the Land Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance & Reconnaissance (LC4ISR) Capability sustainment. This is the second Request for Proposal (RFP) related to the LC4ISR Capability, and two more RFPs will be published before January 2023.

**Security Requirements:**
The procurement of this solicitation is governed by the National Security Exception (NSE). As such, the bid process is limited to Canadian suppliers only. Bidders are required to meet the security requirements outlined in the Security Requirement Checklist (SRCL) and the security clauses specified in the RFP.

**Key Proposal Requirement:**
Interested suppliers are invited to submit a bid for the provision of Core Network Sustainment Services. The successful bidder will be required to complete a Foreign Ownership, Control and Influence (FOCI) questionnaire and provide associated documentation prior to contract award.

**Important Instructions:**

* Suppliers interested in submitting a bid must complete a Contract Security Program Application for Registration (AFR) form at the time of submission.
* All documentation can be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).
* Documents may be accessed online at [Canada's Procurement Gateway](https://canadabuys.canada.ca).
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Security Requirements for Contracting with Canada:**
Further information on the security requirements for contracting with the Government of Canada can be found at [Security Requirements for Contracting with the Government of Canada - Canada.ca](https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/index-eng.html).

**Contact Information:**
For any questions or clarifications, please contact:

Brendan Ellingham
Mail Point 8 C2, Place du Portage, 11 Laurier St., Phase III, Gatineau QC K1A 0S5
brendan.ellingham@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
(873) 354-2211

**Rationale for Limited Tendering:**
No rationale for limited tendering is provided. The solicitation is open for bids from
